entry.def: A cramped room or building is not big enough for the people or things in it.

example.ex: There are hundreds of families living in cramped conditions on the floor of the airport lounge...
example.tran: 数百个家庭住在机场候机室拥挤的地板上。

example.ex: In later years he lived in a rather cramped little flat in Bristol.
example.tran: 他晚年住在布里斯托尔一间相当狭小的公寓内。

sentences.sentence: "trying to bring children up in cramped high-rise apartments"

sentences.en: He cooked for himself in the cramped kitchen.
sentences.cn: 他在狭窄的小厨房里为自己做饭烧菜。

sentences.en: I walked up and down the aisle to stretch my cramped muscles.
